permission.tips.message: In some cases, using v-permission will have no effect. For example: Element-UI  el-tab or el-table-column and other scenes that dynamically render dom. You can only do this with v-if.

guide.description.message: The guide page is useful for some people who entered the project for the first time. You can briefly introduce the features of the project. Demo is based on

components.tinymceTips.message: Rich text is a core feature of the management backend, but at the same time it is a place with lots of pits. In the process of selecting rich texts, I also took a lot of detours. The common rich texts on the market have been basically used, and I finally chose Tinymce. See the more detailed rich text comparison and introduction.

components.dropzoneTips.message: Because my business has special needs, and has to upload images to qiniu, so instead of a third party, I chose encapsulate it by myself. It is very simple, you can see the detail code in @/components/Dropzone.

components.stickyTips.message: when the page is scrolled to the preset position will be sticky on the top.

components.backToTopTips1.message: When the page is scrolled to the specified position, the Back to Top button appears in the lower right corner

components.backToTopTips2.message: You can customize the style of the button, show / hide, height of appearance, height of the return. If you need a text prompt, you can use element-ui el-tooltip elements externally

components.imageUploadTips.message: Since I was using only the vue@1 version, and it is not compatible with mockjs at the moment, I modified it myself, and if you are going to use it, it is better to use official version.

table.dynamicTips1.message: Fixed header, sorted by header order

table.dynamicTips2.message: Not fixed header, sorted by click order

example.warning.message: Creating and editing pages cannot be cached by keep-alive because keep-alive include does not currently support caching based on routes, so it is currently cached based on component name. If you want to achieve a similar caching effect, you can use a browser caching scheme such as localStorage. Or do not use keep-alive include to cache all pages directly. See details

errorLog.description.message: Now the management system are basically the form of the spa, it enhances the user experience, but it also increases the possibility of page problems, a small negligence may lead to the entire page deadlock. Fortunately Vue provides a way to catch handling exceptions, where you can handle errors or report exceptions.

theme.tips.message: Tips: It is different from the theme-pick on the navbar is two different skinning methods, each with different application scenarios. Refer to the documentation for details.

courseManage.msg48.message: When recording lecture videos, the recording system will use AI algorithms to identify the number of students in the classroom to estimate attendance rate. Due to the limitation of the number and angle of cameras, this attendance rate is not completely accurate. It is only used as a reference for instructional review and is not linked to students' grades.

attendance.msg1.message: When recording lecture videos, the recording system will use AI algorithms to identify the number of students in the classroom to estimate attendance rate. Due to the limitation of the number and angle of cameras, this attendance rate is not completely accurate. It is only used as a reference for instructional review and is not linked to students' grades.

attendance.msg2.message: 2. The AI algorithm can also identify students by comparing photos. If you use this function, the administrator needs to import students' photos in advance in Course Management. Using this function means that the school is aware of the privacy issues that may exist with this function.

permisSubtitle.downloadTaskTip1.message: Multiple videos from podium, student and screen cameras are generated for lecture capture. The splicing function can combine these videos from multiple sources into one video. You can select to do so on the recording playback's download interface. It takes 30-60 minutes to splice a video, and you can check the splicing progress on this page.

permisSubtitle.demandTip1.message: The session recording playback is on-demand allowed. After the video is published, students can view the recording video on-demand.

permisSubtitle.demandTip2.message: The session recording playback is on-demand disallowed. If you want students to view the recording video on-demand, please set it as on-demand allowed.

permisSubtitle.publicTip1.message: Publish to the course's Resources (students can view it) and My Resources

permisSubtitle.jointVideoTip.message: To combine multiple video streams from this session to display in a single video screen, the platform needs to splice/remix these videos from multiple sources. The process takes 30-60 minutes.

permisSubtitle.jointVideoTip1.message: Closing the window does not affect video splicing. You can click the  Splice Videos button in the upper right corner to check the video splicing progress.

translation.msg30.message: UClass Smart Recording System allows one recorder across multiple classrooms to capture lectures regularly or manually at low cost. It also supports reviewers’ remote real-time lecture review, playback review, and smart attendance. Recorded lecture videos can be published to courses hosted on your LMS for students to view any time any where.

translation.msg31.message: Smart normalized lecture recording and review at low-cost

translation.msg32.message: Integrated with LMS for learning resource sharing and reuse

translation.msg33.message: Video + AI - Smart editing, analysis and evaluation

videoPlayer.multichannelVideoMerging.message: Multi-stream video (Capture video from multiple recording devices simultaneously and combine them into one video)

videoPlayer.attentionCue.message: By analyzing the lecture video, the postures and behaviors of students can be identified, such as listening, head resting on desk, etc.. The changing trends of students’ Facing-Up rate and Head-On-Desk rate curves can reflect the changes in students’ learning status to a certain extent and provide certain insights for school administrators. Facing-Up rate: the proportion of students’ listening behavior to all behaviors. Head-On-Desk rate: the ratio of students lying on the desk to all behaviors.

videoPlayer.teacherBehaviorCue.message: By analyzing the lecture video, the teacher's instructional behaviors can be identified, such as lecturing, blackboard/whiteboard writing, etc.. The system can count the duration of each instructional behavior and its distribution throughout the teaching process.

videoPlayer.teacherLate.message: The teacher is suspected to be 5 minutes late

videoPlayer.teachersLeaveEarly.message: The teacher is suspected of leaving 5 minutes early

videoPlayer.instructionalAnalysisMethod.message: S-T Teaching Analysis - Sampling and analyzing the instructional behaviors in the classroom. T means that the teacher's behavior is dominant at the current time, including teacher's lecturing, blackboard/whiteboard writing, and instruction. S means that the student's behavior is dominant. The S-T analysis can quantify instructional behaviors and deduce the classroom instructional model.

videoPlayer.concentrationRatio.message: Facing-Up rate = the proportion of students’ listening behavior to all behaviors. Head-On-Desk rate = the ratio of students lying on the desk to all behaviors.

videoPlayer.annotatedAnalysisResults.message: Annotate the results of behavioral analysis on the video

videoPlayer.markingProcess.message: Annotating the results of behavioral analysis on the video, which lasts about 1 hour.

videoPlayer.analysisResultPrompt.message: The system can mark the results of teacher and student behavior analysis on the video. Click the Start button to annotate the video. The entire process takes about an hour (This annotation is only displayed in the analysis report and students will not see these annotations when watching lecture playbacks).

videoPlayer.clockToAnalysis.message: Click here to analyze the video

videoPlayer.analysisTip.message: Video analysis is in progress and expected to last 10-20 minutes

permisSubtitle.videoWithoutSound.message: The video has no sound. Click here to mix the sound before downloading.

permisSubtitle.mergerProgress.message: The sounds are being merged and are expected to last 30 minutes. Please download later.

permisSubtitle.titleGeneration.message: Subtitles are being generated. Please check back later.

common.shareByPhoneTip.message: Scan the QR code to watch or share on your phone

videoPlayer.tip1.message: Annotate the behaviors of teachers and students in the video. This feature is an add-on and optional and will not affect classroom behavior analysis. Annotating postures in videos takes up a lot of computing power. The system will not automatically annotate videos. The admin must manually select the video in task management to start annotation.

videoPlayer.tip2.message: Annotate the behavior of teachers and students in the video

videoPlayer.tip3.message: The video is being annotated and the process will last about 1-2 hours.

videoPlayer.tip4.message: Video analysis relies on captions/subtitles. If there are no captions/subtitles, generate captions/subtitles first and then conduct the analysis.

intelligentAnalysis.teachingTimingDistri.message: Time allocation of instructional activities - Minutes

intelligentAnalysis.content1.message: By analyzing the lecture video, the teacher's instructional behaviors can be identified, such as lecturing, blackboard/whiteboard writing, etc.. The system can count the duration of each instructional behavior and its distribution throughout the teaching process.

intelligentAnalysis.content2.message: S-T Teaching Analysis - Sampling and analyzing the instructional behaviors in the classroom. T means that the teacher's behavior is dominant at the current time, including teacher's lecturing, blackboard/whiteboard writing, and instruction. S means that the student's behavior is dominant. The S-T analysis can quantify instructional behaviors and deduce the classroom instructional model.

intelligentAnalysis.content3.message: By analyzing the lecture video, the postures and behaviors of students can be identified, such as listening, head resting on desk, etc.. The changing trends of students’ Facing-Up rate and Head-On-Desk rate curves can reflect the changes in students’ learning status to a certain extent and provide certain insights for school administrators. Facing-Up rate: the proportion of students’ listening behavior to all behaviors. Head-On-Desk rate: the ratio of students lying on the desk to all behaviors.

intelligentAnalysis.content4.message: Based on semantic recognition, the semantic library corresponding to the teaching behavior to be recognized can be set in the admin backend.

intelligentAnalysis.tip1.message: The teaching mode of this session is:

intelligentAnalysis.tip2.message: The average lecturing volume of this session is {avgDB} dB. The maximum is {maxDB} dB. There are {noVolumeCount} silent segments (no lecturing for more than 10 seconds).

intelligentAnalysis.tip3.message: The square represents the UClass session, and the color represents the current instructional segment in that session.

intelligentAnalysis.tip5.message: The normal speaking pace is 200-250 words

recordedClass.recordingNew1.message: The school has a total of {num} recording classrooms
